Class LevelSelect

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • LevelSelect
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class LevelSelect
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    This is the class that asks the user which level they would like to start out with. They can choose levels 1-3, or they can choose to exit. Note that since javadoc is not picking up caught exceptions, we included the exceptions in the local variables.

    Verison 1 (2 Hours): The background and mouse listener is added. Done by Tiffany

    Verison 2 (2 Hours): The enter userName method was added. Done by Aashmika

    Version:
    1 05.14.16 Program name: LevelSelect.java
    Author:
    Tiffany Tran modified by Aashmika Mali
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • LevelSelect

        public LevelSelect()
        The constructor. It takes the parameter of the JFrame so the image can be outputted based on it. It also resets all the scores, dispays the background, and uses mouse listener. The try catch block is used to prevent the program from crashing when getting the image. This constructor makes it possible for users to use keyboard shortcuts.

        Local variables:

        lvl1 This points to the Action class.

        lvl2 This points to the Action class.

        lvl3 This points to the Action class.

        back This points to the Action class.

        Parameters:

        e - This points to the ActionEvent class.

        Exceptions:

        IOException e It is the caught exception when getting the image.

    • Method Detail

      • getUserName

        public void getUserName(java.lang.String title,
                        java.lang.String message,
                        javax.swing.JFrame frame)
        This method creates a dialog window and asks the user to enter their username. This username is displayed on the ceritificate and on the highscores board. The user can only print the certificate when they reach level 3 The ActionListener class inside the method is used in case of a button being pressed. It has the abstract class actionPerformed.

        Local variables:

        myDialog This creates an instance of the JDialog class, and is used to ask the user for their name.

        inputField This creates an instance of the JTextfield class and is used for the user to enter their name in.

        labelMessage This creates an instance of the JLabel, and is used to tell the user to enter their name.

        enterName This creates an instance of the JButton class, and is pressed by the user when they have entered their name.

        Parameters:
        title - is a String for the JDailog box
        message - is a String for the JLabel in the box.
        frame - is a JFrame passed in from the driver.

        Parameters:

        e - This points to the ActionEvent class.
